arts.ttl: Exeter City 'wake-up call' sees Grecians fightback to pick up point
arts.sum: Exeter City defender Jack Fitzwater said that the Grecians needed the wake-up call of falling behind to Wigan Athletic to really get going and fightback to earn a point. “We probably needed it,” Fitzwater said of conceding the goal.

arts.ttl: Exeter City 1 Wigan Athletic 1 - Grecians closer to safety after draw - Devon Live
arts.sum: Dale Taylor put Wigan ahead early in the second half, slotting home from the penalty spot after Maleace Asamoah had been brought down in the box. Cole though in the 69 th minute levelled it up with a half volley from the edge of the box that bounced into the top corner.

arts.ttl: Wigan Athletic chief assesses Exeter City draw - 'That's the remit'
arts.sum: Ryan Lowe insisted Wigan Athletic's 1-1 draw at Exeter City was 'a big point' towards the ultimate goal of League One survival.

arts.ttl: Wigan Athletic make their point at Exeter City as Dale Taylor ensures they pay the penalty
arts.sum: Wigan Athletic picked up another point on the road with Dale Taylor's second-half penalty helping them to a 1-1 draw at Exeter City.

arts.ttl: Reece Cole’s goal earns Exeter a point against Wigan
arts.sum: Dale Taylor had put Latics ahead from the penalty spot.

arts.ttl: Exeter City to take closer look at source of injury issues
arts.sum: Exeter City manager Gary Caldwell will take a close look at the Grecians’ injuries when this season ends, to ensure there is no such repeat next year. “It is a difficult thing to deal with, but it is something we want to try and get better at next season because when we have most of the squad fit and available, we pick up good results and that has a big baring on our results, so we have to try and make it better next year.”

arts.ttl: Exeter City need to make amends after lacklustre loss
arts.sum: “Body language in training is very important, we need to see players that are ready to put themselves out there and play at a level that is much, much better than Saturday and try and get three points. It feels like Deja-vu as, after an even worse performance in losing 2-0 at home to Stockport County at the weekend, the Grecians are looking to fare better once again when they welcome Wigan Athletic to St James Park tonight.

arts.ttl: Former Exeter City player Danny Bailey diagnosed with cancer
arts.sum: A FUNDRAISING campaign has been launched for the former Exeter City crowd favourite Danny Bailey, who has recently been diagnosed with stage four prostate cancer. “Danny founded Interwood Football Academy, with his late brother, Trevor Bailey, where he has mentored and shaped the futures of countless young players.

arts.ttl: Wigan Athletic: Two changes in our expected team v Exeter City!
arts.sum: Paul Kendrick runs the rule over the Wigan Athletic squad and predicts the 11 men who new head coach Ryan Lowe will select to start at Exeter City on Tuesday.

arts.ttl: Exeter City performance wasn't good enough as Grecians don't cause problems
arts.sum: Exeter City midfielder Ryan Woods admitted that the Grecians’ performance in their 2-0 defeat to Stockport County wasn’t good enough. We don’t cause them enough problems, if anyone was going to score us because of the control we are having, but the performance wasn’t good enough.
